Ju-On 2: The Curse starts in earnest after the events of Ju-On 1 which ended with the real estate agent, Tatsuya Suzuki (Makoto Ashikawa), selling off the house with a troubled history to a young couple, Hiroshi and Yoshimi Kitada (Hua Rong Weng and Kaori Fujii, respectively). At the same time his son Nobuyuki (Tomohiro Kaku) seems to be having some trouble adjusting to their new apartment. You&#039;ll recognize the apartment from the events of the first film and it&#039;s now so rife with bad karma from those events that he&#039;s rendered borderline catatonic. Tatsuya asks his sister Kyoko (Yuko Daike) to see if there&#039;s anything she can do for him, but instead she also gets affected by what she sees there. After discovering the history of the apartment Tatsuya brings Kyoko and Nobuyuki to stay with their parents for a while...Full Review http://www.nipponcinema.com/db/review/ju_on_the_curse_2/
